definition: to grab/to snatch up/variant of 焯[chao1]
to make an appointment/to invite/approximately/pact/treaty/to economize/to restrict/to reduce (a fraction)/concise
to weigh in a balance or on a scale

sentences.english: She is graceful enough to be a dancer.
sentences.chinese: 她風姿綽約，適合當一名舞蹈演員。

sentences.english: Her face is beautiful; her manner is charming; her mouth is full of honeyed words.
sentences.chinese: 她容顏姣好，風姿綽約，滿口甜言蜜語。

sentences.english: In Hangzhou, the Beautiful scenery in a mist looks so charming and graceful .
sentences.chinese: 秀麗的杭州風景，在朦朦細霧中，顯得風姿綽約。

definition: lit. as round as pearls and as smooth as jade (idiom)/fig. elegant and polished (of singing or writing)
tender and beautiful/also written 嬌艷|娇艳
national grace, divine fragrance (idiom); an outstanding beauty
(of a person) valiant and formidable-looking/to carry oneself tall
lit. hiding the moon, shaming the flowers (idiom)/fig. female beauty exceeding even that of the natural world
in different poses and with different expressions/in thousands of postures (idiom)
lit. capable of causing the downfall of a city or state (idiom)/fig. (of a woman) devastatingly beautiful/also written 傾城傾國|倾城倾国[qing1 cheng2 qing1 guo2]
bright and beautiful/(of a landscape) gorgeous/(of a color) vibrant
